channel.title: Carol Hughes
channel.description: Recent news about Carol Hughes, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Wishing everyone a great Labour Day! Bonne journée du travail à tous!

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: La radio CINN FM de Hearst célèbre son 25ième et donne hommage à André Rhéaume, un des fondateurs qui était ému par cette honneur.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Great buys at the Kap Farmers Market today; the pickled beets are delicious and picked up a new throw rug for my Ottawa apartment.

item.title: Mentioned by Manitoulin Expositor
item.description:
Proroguing Parliament will not change the channel for PM, Hughes
KAPUSKASING—Prime Minister Stephen Harper's decision to prorogue Parliament looks like an attempt to avoid accountability and provide the answers Canadian deserve, says local MP Carol Hughes. “After showing up in the Commons only five times ...

item.title: Mentioned by Midnorth Monitor
item.description:
NDP Leader stops by Espanola
New Democratic Party Leader Tom Mulcair and Carol Hughes, MP for Algoma–Manitoulin–Kapuskasing have completed a three-day trip through Northern Ontario, which included stops in Sault Ste. Marie, Espanola, Elliot Lake, Manitoulin Island and Sudbury. When in Espanola, Mulcair and Hughes ... I have been at this a long time and can tell you I am working with a member of parliament who works like few others. The amount of travel, visits and meetings, and that everyone knows her.” He attributed her actions in ...

item.title: Mentioned by Manitoulin Expositor
item.description:
Thomas Mulcair makes Manitoulin stop on tour
Carol Hughes, MP for Algoma-Manitoulin-Kapuskasing, who was on the tour along with Mr. Mulcair, told the Recorder, “we know how much economic importance the Chi-Cheemaun has for the Island and Tobermory. And there are people who are still reeling ...

item.title: Mentioned by Elliot Lake Standard
item.description:
NDP leader takes “listening tour” to Elliot Lake
“As a lawyer and a Member of Parliament I have to be deferential to the judicial process that's now ongoing.” Mulcair and Algoma-Manitoulin-Kapuskasing MP Carol Hughes met with the North Shore Tribal Council for a meeting on Monday morning in Sault ...

item.title: Mentioned by SooToday.com
item.description:
He's here to listen
Federal Opposition Leader Thomas Mulcair (pictured with Algoma-Manitoulin-Kapuskasing New Democrat MP Carol Hughes at Essar Steel Algoma's office Monday) is currently meeting with various stakeholders on a tour of Northern Ontario communities.
